00040 srv1_comm_t *srv1_create(const char *port) { 
00041         srv1_comm_t *ret = (srv1_comm_t *) malloc(sizeof(srv1_comm_t));
00042 
00043         ret->fd = -1; 
00044         ret->image_mode = SRV1_IMAGE_OFF;
00045         ret->set_image_mode = SRV1_IMAGE_OFF;
00046         ret->need_ir = 0;
00047 
00048         ret->frame_size = 0;
00049 
00050         ret->vx = 0.0; 
00051         ret->va = 0.0;
00052 
00053         ret->frame = NULL;
00054 
00055         strncpy(ret->port, port, sizeof(ret->port) - 1);
00056 
00057         return ret;
00058 } 
00059 
00060 /* 
00061  * Flips non-blocking bit.
00062  */
00063 int flip_nonblock(int fd) {
00064         int flags;
00065         if ((flags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL)) < 0) {
00066                 perror("surveyor_flip_nonblock():fcntl():");
00067                 close(fd);
00068                 return -1;
00069         }
00070 
00071         if (fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, flags ^ O_NONBLOCK) < 0) {
00072                 perror("surveyor_flip_nonblock():fcntl():");
00073                 close(fd);
00074                 return -1;
00075         }
00076 
00077         return 0;
00078 }

00080 
00081 int32_t msecsub(struct timeval a, struct timeval b) { 
00082         return ((a.tv_sec - b.tv_sec) * 1000000) + (a.tv_usec - b.tv_usec);
00083 } 
00084 
00085 /* 
00086  * Reads b bytes from fd.  times out in s seconds, returning 0.
00087  * Buf needs to have enough space in it (non-checking)
00088  */
00089 int read_limited(int fd, char *buf, int bytes, int microsecs) {
00090         flip_nonblock(fd);
00091 
00092         struct timeval begin, now;
00093         gettimeofday(&begin, NULL);
00094 
00095         int needtoread = bytes;
00096         int readresult;
00097 
00098         for (;;) {
00099                 gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
00100                 if (msecsub(now, begin) > microsecs) {
00101                         printf("read_limited():Warning: CARLOS timed out (%d microsecs).\n", msecsub(now, begin));
00102                         flip_nonblock(fd);
00103                         return (bytes - needtoread);
00104                 }
00105 
00106                 if ((readresult = read(fd, buf + (bytes - needtoread), needtoread)) < 0) {
00107                         if (errno != EAGAIN) {
00108                                 perror("read_limited():read()");
00109                                 flip_nonblock(fd);
00110                                 return -1;
00111                         }
00112                 } else {
00113                         needtoread = needtoread - readresult;
00114                         if (needtoread == 0) {
00115                                 break;
00116                         }
00117                 }
00118 
00119                 usleep(20);
00120         }
00121 
00122         flip_nonblock(fd);
00123         return bytes;
00124 }
00125 
00126 /* 
00127  * Flushes input buffer.
00128  * \return number of bytes discarded.
00129  */ 
00130 int srv1_flush_input(srv1_comm_t *x) {
00131         int res;
00132         ioctl(x->fd, TIOCINQ, (char *)&res);
00133         tcflush(x->fd, TCIFLUSH);
00134         return res;
00135 }

00137 int srv1_open(srv1_comm_t *x) { 
00138 
00139         struct termios term;
00140         int flags; 
00141         int fd; 
00142 
00143         printf("Opening connection to Surveyor on %s...", x->port);
00144 
00145         if ((fd = open(x->port, O_RDWR | O_NONBLOCK, S_IRUSR, S_IWUSR)) < 0) {
00146                 perror("surveyor_open():open():");
00147                 return 0;
00148         }
00149 
00150         if (tcflush(fd, TCIFLUSH) < 0) {
00151                 perror("surveyor_open():tcflush():");
00152                 close(fd);
00153                 return 0;
00154         }
00155 
00156         if (tcgetattr(fd, &term) < 0) {
00157                 perror("surveyor_open():tcgetattr():");
00158                 close(fd);
00159                 return 0;
00160         }
00161 
00162         cfmakeraw(&term);
00163         cfsetispeed(&term, B115200);
00164         cfsetospeed(&term, B115200);
00165 
00166         if (tcsetattr(fd, TCSAFLUSH, &term) < 0) {
00167                 perror("surveyor_open():tcsetattr():");
00168                 close(fd);
00169                 return 0; 
00170         }
00171 
00172         /* Let's set blocking for now. */
00173         flip_nonblock(fd);
00174 
00175         puts("Done.");
00176 
00177         x->fd = fd;
00178 
00179         return 1;
00180 }

00182 void srv1_close(srv1_comm_t *x) {
00183         printf("\nCARLOS: now closing srv1_close()\n");
00184         srv1_set_speed(x, 0, 0);
00185         
00186         close(x->fd);
00187 }

00189 void srv1_destroy(srv1_comm_t *x) { 
00190         if (x->frame != NULL) { 
00191                 free(x->frame);
00192         } 
00193 
00194         if (x->fd != -1) {
00195                 srv1_close(x);
00196         } 
00197 
00198         free(x);
00199         return;
00200 }

00202 int srv1_init(srv1_comm_t *x) { 
00203         assert(x);
00204 
00205         if (srv1_open(x) == 0) {
00206                 // Error. srv1_open handles half-open closing.
00207                 return 0;
00208         } 
00209 
00210         // Check to see that we can communicate by sending a #V
00211         char buf[256];
00212         if (write(x->fd, "V", 1) < 0) {
00213                 printf("srv1_init(): can't write to port %d!\n", x->port);
00214                 return 0;
00215         } 
00216 
00217         int spot = 0;
00218         memset(buf, 0, 256);
00219 //      while(buf[spot-1] != '\n') { // CARLOS: Changed the array subscript that was below array bounds
00220 //              int num = read(x->fd, buf + spot, 1);
00221 //              if (num != 1) {
00222 //                      printf("srv1_init(): Can't read a byte from surveyor!\n");
00223 //                      return 0;
00224 //              }
00225 //              spot++;
00226 //      }
00227 
00228 //      Compiled before:
00229 //         do { // CARLOS: Changed the array subscript that was below array bounds
00230 //                  int num = read(x->fd, buf + spot, 1);
00231 //                  if (num != 1) {
00232 //                          printf("srv1_init(): Can't read a byte from surveyor!\n");
00233 //                          return 0;
00234 //                  }
00235 //                  spot++;
00236 //           }
00237 //         while(buf[spot-1] != '\n');
00238 
00239 // Original:
00240          while(buf[spot-1] != '\n') {
00241                   int num = read(x->fd, buf + spot, 1);
00242                   if (num != 1) {
00243                           printf("srv1_init(): Can't read a byte from surveyor!\n");
00244                           return 0;
00245                   }
00246                   spot++;
00247           }
00248         // Print the version number
00249         printf("srv1_init(): successful init. HW %s", buf + 2);
00250 
00251         return 1;
00252 }
00253 
00254 double calc_forward(signed char speed) {
00255         unsigned char speedg = (speed > 0 ? speed : -speed);
00256         if (speedg < 20) {
00257                 return 0;
00258         } 
00259         double i3 = 5.5277e-7;
00260         double j3 = -0.00016261;
00261         double k3 = 0.01628;
00262         double l3 = -0.26129;
00263         // third order is ultra-small... probably second-order.
00264         double x = k3 * speedg;
00265         double y = j3 * speedg * speedg;
00266         double z = i3 * speedg * speedg * speedg;
00267         double result = l3 + x + y + z;
00268         printf("calc_forward(%d) = %f + %f + %f + %f = %f\n", speed, l3, x, y, z, result);
00269         return (speed > 0 ? result : -result);
00270 } 
00271 
00272 signed char calc_speed_hackish(double dx) { 
00273         if (fabs(dx) > SRV1_MAX_VEL_X) {
00274                 printf("srv1_set_speed(): warning: speed out of range.\n");
00275                 return (dx > 0.0 ? 127 : -127);
00276         }
00277 
00278         if (fabs(dx) < 0.05) {
00279                 return 0;
00280         } 
00281 
00282         signed char current = 20;
00283 
00284         for (;;) {
00285                 current = current + 1;
00286                 if (calc_forward(current) > fabs(dx)) { 
00287                         return (dx < 0.0 ? -(current - 1) : current - 1);
00288                 } 
00289         } 
00290 }
00291 
00292 double calc_angular(int left, int right) {
00293         double basis = 0.234;
00294         printf("calc_angular(%d, %d) = %f\n", left, right, (calc_forward(right) - calc_forward(left)) / basis);
00295         return (calc_forward(right) - calc_forward(left)) / basis;
00296 }
00297 
00298 void calc_rot_hackish(double dx, signed char *left, signed char *right) {
00299         int direction = 0;
00300         int l = *left; 
00301         int r = *right;
00302         double angular = 0;
00303         double newangular;
00304         if (fabs(dx) < 0.05) {
00305                 return;
00306         } 
00307         // If not moving, move both
00308         if (l == 0) { 
00309                 while ((l > -127) && (l < 127) 
00310                                 && (r > -127) && (r < 127)) { 
00311                         angular = calc_angular(l, r);
00312                         if (angular < dx) { 
00313                                 if (direction == -1) { 
00314                                         break;
00315                                 }
00316                                 if (r < 20) {
00317                                         r = 20;
00318                                         l = -r;
00319                                 } 
00320                                 // left back, right forward.
00321                                 l--; r++;
00322                                 direction = 1;
00323                         } 
00324                         if (angular > dx) {
00325                                 if (direction == 1) { 
00326                                         break;
00327                                 } 
00328                                 if (l < 20) {
00329                                         l = 20;
00330                                         r = -l;
00331                                 } 
00332                                 l++; r--;
00333                                 direction = -1;
00334                         }
00335                 }
00336         // If going forward, shift up to attempt rotation
00337         } else if (l > 0) { 
00338                 while ((l < 127) && (r < 127)) {
00339                         angular = calc_angular(l, r);
00340                         if (angular < dx) { 
00341                                 if (direction == -1) {
00342                                         break;
00343                                 } 
00344                                 // Right faster
00345                                 r++;
00346                                 direction = 1;
00347                         }
00348                         if (angular > dx) { 
00349                                 if (direction == 1) {
00350                                         break; 
00351                                 }
00352                                 l++;
00353                                 direction = -1;
00354                         } 
00355                 }
00356         // If going backward, shift down to attempt rotation
00357         } else { 
00358                 while ((l > -127) && (r > -127)) {
00359                         angular = calc_angular(l, r);
00360                         if (angular < dx) {
00361                                 if (direction == -1) {
00362                                         break;
00363                                 }
00364                                 // Left slower = backwards faster
00365                                 l--;
00366                                 direction = 1;
00367                         } 
00368                         if (angular > dx) {
00369                                 if (direction == 1) {
00370                                         break;
00371                                 } 
00372                                 r--;
00373                                 direction = -1;
00374                         } 
00375                 }
00376         }
00377         
00378         if (((r == 127) || (r == -127) || (l == 127) || (l == -127))
00379                         && (fabs(dx - calc_angular(l, r)) > 0.01)) {
00380                 printf("srv1_set_speed(): warning: can't achieve %f rotation. got %f.\n",
00381                                 dx, calc_angular(l, r));
00382         }
00383 
00384         *right = r; 
00385         *left = l;
00386 }

00388 int srv1_set_motors(srv1_comm_t *x, signed char l, signed char r, double t) {
00389         char cmdbuf[4];
00390 //      float timeunits;
00391         char runtime;
00392 
00393 //      timeunits = t * 100;
00394 //      if (timeunits > 255) {
00395 //              runtime = 255;
00396 //      } else if (timeunits < 0) {
00397 //              runtime = 0;
00398 //      } else {
00399 //              runtime = timeunits;
00400 //      }
00401         
00402         runtime = 0;  // CARLOS: forcing an indefinite duration
00403 
00404         // Command:    'Mabc'
00405         //      direct motor control
00406         //      'abc' parameters sent as 8-bit binary
00407         //
00408         //      a=left speed, b=right speed, c=duration*10milliseconds
00409         //
00410         //      speeds are 2's complement 8-bit binary values
00411         //             - 0x00 through 0x7F is forward,
00412         //             0xFF through 0x81 is reverse,
00413         //      e.g. the decimal equivalent of the 4-byte sequence 0x4D 0x32 0xCE 0x14 = 'M' 50 -50 20 (rotate right for 200ms)
00414         //
00415         //      duration of 00 is infinite, e.g. the 4-byte sequence 0x4D 0x32 0x32 0x00 = M 50 50 00 (drive forward at 50% indefinitely)
00416         cmdbuf[0] = 'M';
00417         cmdbuf[1] = l;
00418         cmdbuf[2] = r;
00419         cmdbuf[3] = runtime;
00420 
00421         if (write(x->fd, cmdbuf, 4) < 0) {
00422                 // TODO: do something useful
00423 //              return 0;   // CARLOS: thinks this should be commented this out here
00424         } 
00425 
00426         // Response:   '#M'
00427         if (read_limited(x->fd, cmdbuf, 2, 250000) == 2) {
00428                 if (cmdbuf[0] == '#' &&
00429                                 cmdbuf[1] == 'M') {
00430                         return 1;
00431                 }
00432                 printf("srv1_set_speed(): warning: failed response: %c%c!!!\n", cmdbuf[0], cmdbuf[1]);
00433                 int bytes = srv1_flush_input(x);
00434                 printf("srv1: flushed %d bytes from input buffer..\n");
00435 //              return 0;   // CARLOS: thinks this should be commented this out here
00436         }
00437 
00438         return 0;
00439 }

00441 int srv1_set_speed(srv1_comm_t *x, double dx, double dw) { 
00442 
00443         signed char leftspeed;
00444         signed char rightspeed;
00445 
00446         printf("srv1_set_speed(): debug: dx: %2.2f dw: %2.2f\n", dx, dw);
00447         leftspeed = calc_speed_hackish(dx); 
00448 
00449         rightspeed = leftspeed;
00450         
00451         x->vx = calc_forward(leftspeed);
00452 
00453         calc_rot_hackish(dw, &leftspeed, &rightspeed);
00454 
00455         x->va = calc_angular(leftspeed, rightspeed);
00456 
00457         // The SRV-1 speed gets actually set here
00458         // Moving the motors for an indefinitely amount of time (0.0)
00459         return srv1_set_motors(x, leftspeed, rightspeed, 0.0);
00460 }

00463 int srv1_fill_image(srv1_comm_t *x) {
00464         
00465         char specbuf[10];
00466 
00467         memset(specbuf, 0, 10);
00468 
00469         if (x->set_image_mode != x->image_mode) {       
00470                 if (x->image_mode != SRV1_IMAGE_OFF) {
00471                         printf("srv1_fill_image(): setting image mode '%c'\n", x->image_mode);
00472                         if (write(x->fd, &(x->image_mode), 1) < 0) { 
00473                                 return 0; 
00474                         } 
00475 
00476                         int done = read_limited(x->fd, specbuf, 2, 500000);
00477                         
00478                         if (done != 2) {
00479                                 // TODO: do something more important
00480                                 int btsdead = srv1_flush_input(x);
00481                                 printf("srv1_fill_image(): discarded %d bytes.\n", btsdead);
00482                                 return 0;
00483                         }
00484 
00485                         if (specbuf[0] != '#' || specbuf[1] != x->image_mode) {
00486                                 printf("srv1_fill_image(): didn't get correct response from image size set: %s\n", specbuf);
00487                                 int btsdead = srv1_flush_input(x);
00488                                 printf("srv1_fill_image(): discarded %d bytes.\n", btsdead);
00489                                 return 0;
00490                         } else {
00491                                 x->set_image_mode = x->image_mode;
00492                         }
00493                 } else {
00494                         x->set_image_mode = x->image_mode;
00495                 } 
00496         }
00497 
00498         if (x->set_image_mode == SRV1_IMAGE_OFF) {
00499                 return 1;
00500         } 
00501         printf("srv1_fill_image(): Image Mode '%c'\n", x->set_image_mode);
00502         int tries = 1;
00503         for (;;) {
00504                 if (write(x->fd, "I", 1) < 0) { 
00505                         // TODO: do something with this
00506                         return 0;
00507                 } 
00508 
00509                 printf("srv1_fill_image(): getting spec.\n");
00510 
00511                 memset(specbuf, 0, 10);
00512                 int done = read_limited(x->fd, specbuf, 10, 500000);
00513 
00514                 if (done != 10) {
00515                         int btsdead = srv1_flush_input(x);
00516                         if (tries < 10) {
00517                                 tries++;
00518                                 // Try again!
00519                                 continue;
00520                         } 
00521                         // give up!
00522                         printf("srv1_fill_image(): didn't get spec (got %d bytes: %s). flushed %d bytes.\n", done, specbuf, btsdead);
00523                         return 0;
00524                 } else {
00525                         break; 
00526                 } 
00527         } 
00528 
00529         if (strncmp("##IMJ", specbuf, 5) != 0) { 
00530                 int btsdead = srv1_flush_input(x);
00531                 printf("srv1_fill_image(): incorrect response from I, flushed %d\n", btsdead);
00532                 return 0; 
00533         }
00534         int s0 = (unsigned char)specbuf[6];
00535         int s1 = (unsigned char)specbuf[7];
00536         int s2 = (unsigned char)specbuf[8];
00537         int s3 = (unsigned char)specbuf[9];
00538 
00539         x->frame_size = s0 + (s1 * 256) + (s2 * 256 * 256) + (s3 * 256 * 256 * 256);
00540 
00541         printf("srv1_fill_image(): specbuf: %c%c%c%c%c%c\n", specbuf[0], specbuf[1], specbuf[2], specbuf[3], specbuf[4], specbuf[5]);
00542         printf("srv1_fill_image(): frame_size = %d + (%d * 256) + (%d * 256 * 256) + (%d * 256 * 256 * 256) = %d\n",  s0, s1, s2, s3,  x->frame_size);
00543 //      printf("srv1_fill_image(): spec size %d\n", x->frame_size);
00544 
00545 
00546         if (x->frame == NULL) { 
00547                 x->frame = (char *)malloc(x->frame_size);
00548         } else { 
00549                 x->frame = (char *)realloc(x->frame, x->frame_size);
00550         } 
00551 
00552         // 1.5 secs is long enough.
00553         read_limited(x->fd, x->frame, x->frame_size, 1500000);
00554 
00555         return 1;
00556 }
00557 
00558 int srv1_fill_ir(srv1_comm_t *x) {
00559         if (write(x->fd, "B", 1) < 0) { 
00560                 return 0; 
00561         } 
00562 
00563         char buf[80]; // Real length: 13 for header + 32 for chars.
00564         memset(buf, 0, 80);
00565         int done = read_limited(x->fd, buf, 46, 500000);
00566 
00567         if (done != 46) {
00568                 // TODO: do something more important
00569                 int btsdead = srv1_flush_input(x);
00570                 printf("srv1_fill_ir(): discarded %d bytes.\n", btsdead);
00571                 return 0;
00572         }
00573 
00574         if (strncmp(buf, "##BounceIR - ", 13) != 0) {
00575                 int btsdead = srv1_flush_input(x);
00576                 printf("srv1_fill_ir(): IR return had wrong header '%s', discarded %d bytes.\n", buf, btsdead);
00577                 return 0;
00578         } 
00579 
00580         sscanf(buf + 13, "%x", &(x->bouncedir[0]));
00581         sscanf(buf + 21, "%x", &(x->bouncedir[1]));
00582         sscanf(buf + 29, "%x", &(x->bouncedir[2]));
00583         sscanf(buf + 37, "%x", &(x->bouncedir[3]));
00584 
00585         return 1;
00586 }

00589         
00590    // CARLOS: Needs to handle returns (1: success), (0: error)
00591         srv1_fill_image(x);
00592         srv1_fill_ir(x);
00593 
00594         return 1;
00595 }

00601 double srv1_range_to_distance(int rangereading) {
00602         // Approximation based on a 3rd order polynomial fit of data: 
00603         //    -6.0333e-05 x^3 + 1.2986e-02 x^2 + -9.6280e-01 x + 4.3082e+01
00604         // TODO: Possibly replace this with a lookup table, or factorize
00605         //  to minimize numerical error.
00606         double a = -6.0333e-5 * rangereading * rangereading * rangereading; 
00607         double b = 1.2986e-2 * rangereading * rangereading; 
00608         double c = -9.6280e-1 * rangereading;
00609         double d = 4.3082e1;
00610 
00611         return a + b + c + d;
00612 }
